etymologies: mid 16th century: from Spanish patata, variant of Taino batata ‘sweet potato’. The English word originally denoted the sweet potato and gained its current sense in the late 16th century

definitions: a starchy plant tuber which is one of the most important food crops, cooked and eaten as a vegetable

examples.text: the meal comes with rice or potato

shortDefinitions: starchy plant tuber which is one of most important food crops

definitions: the plant of the nightshade family that produces the potato tubers on underground runners.

notes.text: Solanum tuberosum, family Solanaceae. It was first cultivated in the Andes about 1,800 years ago and was introduced to Europe in c.1570

shortDefinitions: plant of nightshade family which produces potatoes on underground runners
